message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product which has been designed to meet your specific needs. I believe it can greatly enhance your operations and bring significant value to your business. Given its worth to us and its potential impact on your company, I am offering it to you for $950,000. This is a special introductory price that I hope will allow us to work together and achieve mutual success.

Thank you for the offer, Alice. It's a good starting point, but I'm looking to spend closer to $900,000 for this product. Considering its value to your company, I believe this price is still fair, and allows for a mutually beneficial agreement.  Let me know what you think.

Thank you for your response, Bob. I appreciate your feedback and understand your position. In light of the value you see in this product and to further explore the possibility of a successful collaboration, I would like to propose an adjusted price of $975,000 for the product. This is a slight increase from my initial offer, reflecting some of the costs and considerations involved. I am open to discussing this further and finding a solution that works well for both of us.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $975,000 is still a bit too high for me.  I'm still confident that $900,000 is a fair price for both of us, given its value to your company and my budget.  I'm open to further discussion, but I'm not willing to go any higher than that.

I understand your position, Bob, and I respect your valuation of the product. To continue our dialogue, I am proposing a price of $925,000 for the product. This figure reflects a compromise between our respective positions, aiming to ensure that we both receive a fair return. I am committed to finding a solution that satisfies both parties and would be delighted to discuss this proposal further.
